fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Sudden decrease in kidney function, reduced urine output, fluid retention.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Recent surgery, infection, or use of nephrotoxic drugs.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: Rapid decline in renal filtration function.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Possible fluid overload signs such as peripheral oedema and pulmonary crackles.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: pregnancy
fields.defaultValue: Avoid nephrotoxic agents, manage fluid balance
fields.label: Pregnancy

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Fluid management, renal replacement therapy if necessary
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Progressive loss of kidney function, hypertension, fatigue, and fluid retention.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Diabetes, hypertension, history of kidney problems.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Signs of fluid overload, pallor, and sometimes uraemic frost on the skin.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: pregnancy
fields.defaultValue: Control blood pressure and blood sugar
fields.label: Pregnancy

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Medications to control blood pressure, dietary changes, dialysis as disease advances
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Regular monitoring of kidney function, diet and lifestyle modifications
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Blood in urine, foamy urine due to proteinuria, oedema, high blood pressure.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Can follow infections or be part of systemic disease like lupus.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: Inflammation of the tiny filters in the kidneys (glomeruli).
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Oedema in the lower extremities, occasionally hypertension.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Dietary protein restriction, ACE inhibitors to reduce proteinuria
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Regular monitoring of urine protein and kidney function, blood pressure control
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Severe swelling (oedema), particularly around the eyes and in the ankles and feet, frothy urine.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Can result from various disease that damage the kidneys’ filtering system.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: A kidney disorder causing the body to excrete too much protein in the urine.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Significant oedema, ascites in severe cases.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Corticosteroids, diuretics to manage oedema, ACE inhibitors to reduce proteinuria
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Regular proteinuria and cholesterol monitoring, immunosuppressive therapy as needed
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Severe pain in the side and back, below the ribs, pain during urination, urgent need to urinate.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: Hard deposits formed in the kidneys from minerals and salts.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Pain on palpation in the flank region, haematuria.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Pain relievers, medical therapy to help pass the stone, lithotripsy or surgery for larger stones
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Increased fluid intake, dietary changes to prevent future stones
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: High blood pressure, uncontrolled hypertension despite multiple medications.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: Narrowing of one or both renal arteries.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Abdominal bruit on auscultation, decreased kidney size on one side.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, angioplasty with stenting for some patients
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Blood pressure monitoring, follow-up imaging studies
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Rash, fever, fatigue, and kidney function decline.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: Inflammation of the kidneys tubules and surrounding structures.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Possible rash, signs of fluid overload.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: differentialDiagnosis
fields.defaultValue: Acute kidney injury, urinary tract infection
fields.label: Differential Diagnosis

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Corticosteroids for severe cases, supportive care
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Avoid potential nephrotoxins, monitor renal function
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Bloody diarrhoea, severe abdominal pain, decreased urine output.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Typically follows an infection by certain strains of E. coli bacteria.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: A disease characterised by the destruction of red blood cells, leading to kidney failure.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Pallor, petechiae, signs of anaemia and thrombocytopenia.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: differentialDiagnosis
fields.defaultValue: Thrombotic thrombocytopaenic purpura, disseminated intravascular coagulation
fields.label: Differential Diagnosis

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Plasma exchange, supportive therapy, renal replacement therapy for severe cases
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Monitor for renal recovery, manage blood pressure and fluid balance
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Blood in urine, proteinuria, high blood pressure.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Systemic lupus erythematosus affecting the kidneys.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: An autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks its tissues, causing inflammation and damage to the renal tissue.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Oedema, hypertension, signs of systemic lupus erythematosus.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: differentialDiagnosis
fields.defaultValue: Other causes of glomerulonephritis, IgA nephropathy
fields.label: Differential Diagnosis

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Regular monitoring of kidney function and proteinuria, manage blood pressure
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Progressive proteinuria, worsening blood pressure control, decline in renal function.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: Kidney damage resulting from the effects of diabetes on the microvasculature.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Signs of fluid overload, possible retinopathy.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: pregnancy
fields.defaultValue: Strict glycemic and blood pressure control
fields.label: Pregnancy

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: ACE inhibitors or ARBs, dietary protein restriction, management of diabetes
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Regular monitoring of urine albumin and kidney function, lifestyle modifications
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Blood in urine, flank pain, mass in the abdomen.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Smoking, obesity, hypertension, family history of kidney cancer.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Palpable mass on one side of the abdomen, not tender.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: pregnancy
fields.defaultValue: Surgical removal of the tumour or kidney
fields.label: Pregnancy

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Regular follow-up with imaging, management of risk factors
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Most are asymptomatic, discovered incidentally on imaging studies.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Unknown; more common in older adults.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Typically no physical findings; large cysts may be palpable.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Ultrasound monitoring, cyst aspiration or surgery if symptomatic
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Regular monitoring for changes in size or symptoms
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Burning during urination, frequent urination, cloudy or strong-smelling urine.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Sexual activity, female anatomy, catheter use.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: Infection in any part of the urinary system.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Suprapubic tenderness, fever in some cases.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Short course antibiotics for uncomplicated UTI, longer course for complicated cases
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Increased fluid intake, cranberry supplements may reduce recurrence
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Severe pain in the side and back, below the ribs, pain that radiates to the lower abdomen and groin.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: Hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Pain on palpation in the costovertebral angle, haematuria.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Medical expulsive therapy, extracorporeal shock wave lithotripsy, surgery if necessary
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Hydration, dietary modifications to prevent recurrence
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: High fever, flank pain, nausea, vomiting, and cloudy urine.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Bacterial infection, often ascending from a lower urinary tract infection.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: systemsSurvey
fields.defaultValue: A type of urinary tract infection that reaches the kidneys.
fields.label: Systems Survey

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Costovertebral angle tenderness, signs of sepsis in severe cases.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: treatment
fields.defaultValue: Hospitalisation for severe cases, oral antibiotics for mild cases
fields.label: Treatment

fields.name: carePlan
fields.defaultValue: Follow-up cultures to ensure eradication of the infection
fields.label: Care Plan

fields.name: chiefComplaint
fields.defaultValue: Blood in urine, flank pain, mass in the abdomen.
fields.label: Chief Complaint

fields.name: socialHistory
fields.defaultValue: Smoking, obesity, hypertension, family history of kidney cancer.
fields.label: Social History

fields.name: physicalExam
fields.defaultValue: Palpable mass on one side of the abdomen, not tender.
fields.label: Physical Exam

fields.name: pregnancy
fields.defaultValue: Surgical removal of the tumour or kidney
fields.label: Pregnancy

fields.label: Care Plan
